level.text: CONSTRUCTION INSPECTION INFRACTIONS
1 Violation of any of the following provisions shall be a Class 1 infraction:
12A DCMR 105.1, 105.1.15, 105.1.16, and 105.1.17 (working without a required permit);
12A DCMR 105.1, 105.1.15.1, 105.1.16.1, and 105.1.17.1 (exceeding scope of permit);
12A DCMR 115.1 (failure to remedy dangerous conditions or remove hazardous materials);
12A DCMR 114.1 (failure to comply with terms of a ‘Stop Work Order’);
12A DCMR 114.1 (unauthorized removal of a posted stop work order);
12A DCMR 115.5 (failure to comply with terms of posted “Unsafe to Use” notice); or
International Property Maintenance Code 302.1 (exterior of property not in clean or sanitary condition).
PLUMBING INSPECTION INFRACTIONS
The following abbreviations apply to this section:
IPC- International Plumbing Code
IPMC- International Property Maintenance Code
1 Violation of the following provision shall be a Class 1 infraction:
IPC 114.3 (failure to comply with terms of a ‘Stop Work Order’);
IPC 120.1 (HVAC work performed by non-D.C. licensed mechanic);
IPMC 505.4 (hot water exceeds 120 degrees °F.);
12A DCMR 114.1 (unauthorized removal of a posted stop work order);
12A DCMR 119.4.4 (plumbing work performed by non-D.C. licensed plumber); or
12A DCMR 105.1 (working without a permit).
2 Violation of the following provisions shall be a Class 2 infraction:
12F DCMR P-1101.2.2 (sump pump discharge into public space);
12F DCMR 1101.2.2 (discharge of water from sump pump directly to adjacent property); or
IPC 802.1-4 (swimming pool water discharge into public/park space).
3 Violation of the following provisions shall be a Class 3 infraction:
IPMC 506.2 (obstruction of drains);
IPMC 506.2 (plumbing system not maintained);
12A DCMR 115.1 (mechanical system not maintained);
12A DCMR 115.1 (downspout(s) not connected to terminals);
IPMC 506.2 (main sewer line obstructed).
4 Violation of the following provisions shall be a Class 4 infraction:
IPMC 505.4 (no hot water at peak demand); or
IPC 604.7 (inadequate water pressure).
ELECTRICAL INSPECTION INFRACTIONS
1 Violation of the following provision shall be a Class 1 infraction:
12A DCMR 105.1.14 (working without the required electrical permit);
12A DCMR 105.1.14.1 (exceeding scope of permit);
12A DCMR § 114A (failure to comply with terms of a Stop Work Order); or
12A DCMR 114.1 (unauthorized removal of a posted stop work order).
BOILER INSPECTION INFRACTIONS
1 Violation of the following provisions shall be a Class 1 infraction:
12A DCMR § 114A (failure to comply with terms of a Stop Work Order);
12A DCMR 114.1 (unauthorized removal of a posted stop work order);
12E DCMR M-013.7 (failure to obtain a boiler Certificate of Inspection);
12E DCMR M-1013.9.1 (violation of conditions of posted Unsafe to Use notice);
12E DCMR M-1014.2.1 (failure to obtain a boiler installation permit);
12E DCMR M- 1014.2.1 (no installations permit for boiler and/or unfired pressure vessels);
17 DCMR 400.2 (operating engineering equipment without proper D.C. engineer’s license); or
12E DCMR M-1013.1.1 (alteration and repair of boilers without required permit).
2 Violation of the following provisions shall be a Class 2 infraction:
12E DCMR M-1014.9.2 (improper location or clearance of a boiler); or
12E DCMR M-1016.1.2 (welder working without a D.C. certification).
3 Violation of the following provision shall be a Class 3 infraction:
12E DCMR M-1013.8 (failure to make a timely repair, alteration, or cleaning, to a boiler specified in a notice of deficiency).
4 Violation of the following provisions shall be a Class 4 infraction:
12E DCMR M-1013.9.1 (improper boiler or pressure vessel operation);
12E DCMR M-1013.9.1 (certificate of inspection not properly posted); or
12A DCMR § 109 (denial of entry to boiler room).
ELEVATOR INSPECTION INFRACTIONS
The following abbreviations apply to this section:
ASME- American Society of Mechanical Engineers
NFPA- National Fire Protection Association
1 Violation of the following provisions shall be a Class 1 infraction:
12A DCMR § 105A (installation of elevators, escalators, dumbwaiters, man lift(s), and other traveyors without a permit);
12A DCMR § 114A (failure to comply with terms of a Stop Work Order);
12A DCMR 114.1 (unauthorized removal of a posted stop work order).or
12A DCMR 115.5 (failure to comply with terms of posted Unsafe to Use notice).
2 Violation of the following provisions shall be a Class 2 infraction:
ASME A17.1- Rule 1001.1 (Failure to have semi-annual inspections performed);
ASME A17.1- Rule 1002.3 (failure to schedule five year governor speed and safety test);
ASME A17.1- Rule 101.1a and/or 101.3d (failure to provide required fire rated door at elevator machine room with self-closing and self-locking device);
ASME A17.1- Rule 101.a, 101.3d (b) and/or 106.1d 4) (failure to provide a UL listed fire rated self-closing, self-locking, device at machine room door of elevators or pit doors);
ASME A17.1 – Rule 204.7a (failure to provide emergency light and bell operation); or
ASME A17.1 – Appendix 211 (failure to repair emergency phone on elevators).
3 Violation of the following provisions shall be a Class 3 infraction:
ASME A17.1- Rule 1206.1h (failure to provide required class fire extinguisher in elevator machine room);
ASME A17.1- Rule 210.1e (3) (failure of elevator to level at floor);
ASME A17.1- Appendix (failure to post fire emergency instruction pictograph adjacent to each non-egress hall push button);
NFPA 70 §620-51(a) (main line disconnects unable to be locked in the off position);
ASME A17.1-Rule 1206.2a (failure to remove all materials not related to the operation from the pit); or
4 Violation of the following provisions shall be a Class 4 infraction:
ASME A17.1- Rule 1206.2a (excessive lint and dust in hoist ways);
ASME A17.1- Rule 101.2 (non-related equipment in elevator machine room);
ASME A17.1- 211 (door closure button on elevators in disrepair); or
ASME A17.1-Rule 1206.2a (unclean elevator pits)
